header_summary:
To address the challenges posed by denial-of-service attacks on Bitcoin's scripting execution, a new proposal introduces the varops budget within a Tapscript leaf version, aimed at regulating operational costs proportional to transaction weight. This approach, documented in the Bitcoin Improvement Proposal ([BIP](https://github.com/rustyrussell/bips/blob/guilt/varops/bip-unknown-varops-budget.mediawiki)), aims to enhance security without compromising computational efficiency by setting a computational budget of 5,200 units per weight unit of the transaction. The proposal's feasibility is under evaluation through benchmarking methods that test the script execution's performance against the varops budget, with a call for community participation in this evaluation through a prototype implementation available on GitHub ([GSR prototype](https://github.com/jmoik/bitcoin/tree/gsr)).

In parallel, the significant growth of the Bitcoin blockchain presents scalability challenges, notably in the initial block download (IBD) process for new nodes. A novel strategy named MergeSync proposes a map/reduce and parallel data processing technique to expedite UTXO-set construction, potentially reducing node synchronization times. This approach, however, skips signature verification, raising security concerns and necessitating further research to assess its performance and security implications comprehensively ([MergeSync discussion](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/mergesync-parallel-utxo-set-construction-in-assumevalid-trust-model/2097)).

Reflecting on Bitcoin's origins, its development has been characterized by a commitment to decentralization, privacy, and open systems, with its anonymous creation by Satoshi Nakamoto posing unique challenges in maintaining secrecy and building trust. The philosophical and spiritual dimensions of Bitcoin's architecture suggest a broader paradigm shift towards distributed sovereignty and collective intelligence, inviting further exploration into the decentralized model's impact on technological and social structures ([Bitcoin's philosophical exploration](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/a-reflective-account-on-satoshi-nakamoto-decentralization-and-the-origins-of-bitcoin/2096)).

recent_posts.title: Benchmarking Bitcoin Script Evaluation for the Varops Budget (GSR)
recent_posts.summary:
- A proposal introduces a varops budget to mitigate denial-of-service attacks on Bitcoin.
- The varops budget links to transaction weight, allocating 5,200 units per weight unit.
- Benchmarks evaluate script performance against size and varops budget, inviting community participation.

recent_posts.title: MergeSync: Parallel UTXO-set construction in assumevalid trust model
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin's blockchain growth presents node setup challenges due to its data volume.
- A novel MergeSync approach aims to speed up node sync using parallel processing.
- This method raises security questions due to the lack of signature verification.

recent_posts.title: A Reflective Account on Satoshi Nakamoto, Decentralization, and the Origins of Bitcoin
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin was proposed in 2008 by Satoshi Nakamoto as a decentralized digital currency.
- Nakamoto's anonymity and a focus on transparency, privacy, and decentralization shaped Bitcoin's early development.
- Bitcoin's architecture promotes a self-sustaining digital currency reflecting a shift towards distributed sovereignty.

recent_posts.title: Benchmarking Bitcoin Script Evaluation for the Varops Budget (Great Script Restoration)
recent_posts.summary:
- A new Tapscript leaf version addresses opcode concerns by mitigating denial-of-service attacks.
- Benchmarking focuses on block-sized scripts to establish a varops budget of 20.8 billion compute units.
- Community input on the varops budget through benchmark testing and GitHub contributions is encouraged.

active_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Reduced Data Temporary Softfork
authors: [BIP Proposal] Reduced Data Temporary Softfork dathonohm
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal aims to limit Bitcoin Core v30's data storage to prioritize its currency role.
- It introduces a temporary soft fork, using proactive and reactive activation methods, expiring after one year.
- Calls for community support and technical contributions to ensure swift and efficient activation.

active_posts.title: Motion to Activate BIP 3
active_posts.summary:
- BIP 3 transitioned to "Proposed" in March 2025 and received updates for improvement.
- Over 600 comments on GitHub endorse the activation of BIP 3, highlighting significant support.
- Updates to BIP 3 focus on better defining the BIP process and excluding AI-generated submissions.

active_posts.title: LNHANCE a soft-fork package
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces LNHANCE for Bitcoin, enhancing Lightning Network efficiency with new opcodes.
- LNHANCE's goal is cautious evolution, avoiding features that might cause Bitcoin community contention.
- The project invites code reviews and community contributions, emphasizing a community-driven development approach.

active_posts.title: Proposal: OP_STARK_VERIFY - Native STARK Proof Verification in Bitcoin Script
active_posts.summary:
- The proposed `OP_STARK_VERIFY` introduces native STARK proof verification to Bitcoin Script.
- It aims to scale Bitcoin, support post-quantum signatures, and enable privacy without off-chain computations.
- The initiative faces challenges like neutrality concerns, proof size issues, and integration risks.

active_posts.title: P2share: how to turn any network (or testnet!) into a bitcoin miner
active_posts.summary:
- The "p2share" network introduces a new bitcoin mining rewards distribution system.
- It awards the entire bitcoin reward to a randomly selected shareholder, minimizing transaction bloat.
- This method aims to enhance fairness, efficiency, and maintain a decentralized mining environment.

active_posts.title: Comparing the performance of ECDSA signature validation in OpenSSL vs. libsecp256k1 over the last decade
active_posts.summary:
- The v31.0 Bitcoin Core release celebrates a decade since adopting libsecp256k1, enhancing signature validation speed.
- Benchmarking shows libsecp256k1 vastly outperforms OpenSSL in ECDSA signature verification on the secp256k1 curve.
- Efforts to improve OpenSSL for secp256k1 have begun, highlighting its growing recognition in cryptographic optimization.

today_in_history_posts.title: Towards a singular payment protocol
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- A new payment protocol proposal offers multi-currency transactions not tied to a specific blockchain.
- The protocol aims for universal utility, with flexible currency and fee options, enhancing Bitcoin functionality.
- Feedback is sought to refine the proposal into a Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP), focusing on payments.
contributors: [bitcoin-dev] Towards a singular payment protocol ee

today_in_history_posts.title: [DRAFT] BOLT 13(?): WatchTower protocol
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Rusty Russell and Sergi Delgado Segura discuss Lightning's WatchTower appointment system.
- They explore message types, client-server requirements, and accountability in QoS.
- Payment methods, DoS risks, and storage solutions for WatchTower are analyzed.

today_in_history_posts.title: CTV, APO, CAT activity on signet
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- BIPs 118, 119, and 347 introduce major scripting changes in Bitcoin, activated on signet.
- BIP 118's APO allows flexible transaction signing; BIP 119's CTV enables complex spend conditions.
- `OP_CAT` from BIP 347 sees broad use, particularly in Proof of Work faucets.
